policies.name: 30-Day Scan Age
policies.description: Alert on deployments with images that haven't been scanned in 30 days

policies.name: 90-Day Image Age
policies.description: Alert on deployments with images that haven't been updated in 90 days

policies.name: ADD Command used instead of COPY
policies.description: Alert on deployments using an ADD command

policies.name: Alpine Linux Package Manager (apk) in Image
policies.description: Alert on deployments with the Alpine Linux package manager (apk) present

policies.name: Alpine Linux Package Manager Execution
policies.description: Alert when the Alpine Linux package manager (apk) is executed at runtime

policies.name: Apache Struts: CVE-2017-5638
policies.description: Alert on deployments with images containing Apache Struts vulnerability CVE-2017-5638

policies.name: CAP_SYS_ADMIN capability added
policies.description: Alert on deployments with containers escalating with CAP_SYS_ADMIN

policies.name: chkconfig Execution
policies.description: Detected usage of the chkconfig service manager; typically this is not used within a container

policies.name: Compiler Tool Execution
policies.description: Alert when binaries used to compile software are executed at runtime

policies.name: Container using read-write root filesystem
policies.description: Alert on deployments with containers with read-write root filesystem

policies.name: Container with privilege escalation allowed
policies.description: Alerts if a deployment has containers with allowPrivilegeEscalation set to true in its security context.

policies.name: crontab Execution
policies.description: Detects the usage of the crontab scheduled jobs editor

policies.name: Cryptocurrency Mining Process Execution
policies.description: Cryptocurrency mining process spawned

policies.name: Curl in Image
policies.description: Alert on deployments with curl present

policies.name: Deployments should have at least one ingress Network Policy
policies.description: Alerts if deployments are missing an ingress Network Policy

policies.name: Deployments with externally exposed endpoints
policies.description: Deployments with externally exposed endpoints represent a higher risk

policies.name: Docker CIS 4.1: Ensure That a User for the Container Has Been Created
policies.description: Containers should run as a non-root user

policies.name: Docker CIS 4.4: Ensure images are scanned and rebuilt to include security patches
policies.description: Images should be scanned frequently for any vulnerabilities. You should rebuild all images to include these patches and then instantiate new containers from them.

policies.name: Docker CIS 4.7: Alert on Update Instruction
policies.description: Ensure update instructions are not used alone in the Dockerfile

policies.name: Docker CIS 5.15: Ensure that the host's process namespace is not shared
policies.description: The Process ID (PID) namespace isolates the process ID space, meaning that processes in different PID namespaces can have the same PID. This creates process level isolation between the containers and the host.

policies.name: Docker CIS 5.16: Ensure that the host's IPC namespace is not shared
policies.description: IPC (POSIX/SysV IPC) namespace provides separation of named shared memory segments, semaphores and message queues. The IPC namespace on the host should therefore not be shared with containers and should remain isolated.

policies.name: Docker CIS 5.19: Ensure mount propagation mode is not enabled
policies.description: Mount propagation mode allows mounting container volumes in Bidirectional, Host to Container, and None modes. Do not use Bidirectional mount propagation mode unless explicitly needed.

policies.name: Docker CIS 5.1 Ensure that, if applicable, an AppArmor Profile is enabled
policies.description: AppArmor is an effective and easy-to-use Linux application security system. It is available on some Linux distributions by default, for example, on Debian and Ubuntu.

policies.name: Docker CIS 5.21: Ensure the default seccomp profile is not disabled
policies.description: Seccomp filtering provides a means to filter incoming system calls. The default seccomp profile uses an allow list to permit a large number of common system calls, and block all others.

policies.name: Docker CIS 5.7: Ensure privileged ports are not mapped within containers
policies.description: The TCP/IP port numbers below 1024 are considered privileged ports. Normal users and processes are not allowed to use them for various security reasons. Containers are, however, allowed to map their ports to privileged ports.

policies.name: Docker CIS 5.9 and 5.20: Ensure that the host's network namespace is not shared
policies.description: When HostNetwork is enabled the container is not placed inside a separate network stack. The container's networking is not containerized when this option is applied. The consequence of this is that the container has full access to the host's network interfaces. It also enables a shared UTS namespace. The UTS namespace provides isolation between two system identifiers: the hostname and the NIS domain name. It is used to set the hostname and the domain which are visible to running processes in that namespace. Processes running within containers do not typically require to know either the hostname or the domain name. The UTS namespace should therefore not be shared with the host.

policies.name: Drop All Capabilities
policies.description: Alert when a deployment does not drop all capabilities.

policies.name: Emergency Deployment Annotation
policies.description: Alert on deployments that use the emergency annotation (e.g. "admission.stackrox.io/break-glass": "ticket-1234") to circumvent StackRox Admission Controller checks

policies.name: Environment Variable Contains Secret
policies.description: Alert on deployments with environment variables that contain 'SECRET'

policies.name: Fixable CVSS >= 6 and Privileged
policies.description: Alert on deployments running in privileged mode with fixable vulnerabilities with a CVSS of at least 6

policies.name: Fixable CVSS >= 7
policies.description: Alert on deployments with fixable vulnerabilities with a CVSS of at least 7

policies.name: Fixable Severity at least Important
policies.description: Alert on deployments with fixable vulnerabilities with a Severity Rating at least Important

policies.name: Images with no scans
policies.description: Alert on deployments with images that have not been scanned

policies.name: Improper Usage of Orchestrator Secrets Volume
policies.description: Alert on deployments that use a Dockerfile with 'VOLUME /run/secrets'

policies.name: Insecure specified in CMD
policies.description: Alert on deployments using 'insecure' in the command

policies.name: iptables Execution
policies.description: Detects execution of iptables; iptables is a deprecated way of managing network state in containers

policies.name: Iptables or nftables Executed in Privileged Container
policies.description: Alert on privileged pods that execute iptables or nftables

policies.name: Kubernetes Actions: Exec into Pod
policies.description: Alerts when Kubernetes API receives request to execute command in container

policies.name: Kubernetes Actions: Port Forward to Pod
policies.description: Alerts when Kubernetes API receives port forward request

policies.name: Kubernetes Dashboard Deployed
policies.description: Alert on the presence of the Kubernetes dashboard service

policies.name: Latest tag
policies.description: Alert on deployments with images using tag 'latest'

policies.name: Linux Group Add Execution
policies.description: Detects when the 'addgroup' or 'groupadd' binary is executed, which can be used to add a new linux group.

policies.name: Linux User Add Execution
policies.description: Detects when the 'useradd', 'adduser' or 'usermod' binary is executed, which can be used to add a new linux user.

policies.name: Log4Shell: log4j Remote Code Execution vulnerability
policies.description: Alert on deployments with images containing the Log4Shell vulnerabilities (CVE-2021-44228 and CVE-2021-45046). There are flaws in the Java logging library Apache Log4j in versions from 2.0-beta9 to 2.15.0, excluding 2.12.2.

policies.name: Login Binaries
policies.description: Processes that indicate login attempts

policies.name: Mount Container Runtime Socket
policies.description: Alert on deployments with a volume mount on the container runtime socket

policies.name: Mounting Sensitive Host Directories
policies.description: Alert on deployments mounting sensitive host directories

policies.name: Netcat Execution Detected
policies.description: Detects execution of netcat in a container

policies.name: Network Management Execution
policies.description: Detects execution of binaries that can be used to manipulate network configuration and management.

policies.name: nmap Execution
policies.description: Alerts when the nmap process launches in a container during run time

policies.name: No CPU request or memory limit specified
policies.description: Alert on deployments that have containers without CPU request or memory limit

policies.name: OpenShift: Central Admin Secret Accessed
policies.description: Alert when the Central secret is accessed.

policies.name: OpenShift: Kubeadmin Secret Accessed
policies.description: Alert when the kubeadmin secret is accessed

policies.name: OpenShift: Kubernetes Secret Accessed by an Impersonated User
policies.description: Alert when user impersonation is used to access a secret within the cluster.

policies.name: Password Binaries
policies.description: Processes that indicate attempts to change passwd

policies.name: Pod Service Account Token Automatically Mounted
policies.description: Protect pod default service account tokens from compromise by minimizing the mounting of the default service account token to only those pods whose application requires interaction with the Kubernetes API.

policies.name: Privileged Container
policies.description: Alert on deployments with containers running in privileged mode

policies.name: Privileged Containers with Important and Critical Fixable CVEs
policies.description: Alert on containers running in privileged mode with important or critical fixable vulnerabilities

policies.name: Process Targeting Cluster Kubelet Endpoint
policies.description: Detects misuse of the healthz/kubelet API/heapster endpoint

policies.name: Process Targeting Cluster Kubernetes Docker Stats Endpoint
policies.description: Detects misuse of the Kubernetes docker stats endpoint

policies.name: Process Targeting Kubernetes Service Endpoint
policies.description: Detects misuse of the Kubernetes Service API endpoint

policies.name: Process with UID 0
policies.description: Alert on deployments that contain processes running with UID 0

policies.name: Rapid Reset: Denial of Service Vulnerability in HTTP/2 Protocol
policies.description: Alert on deployments with images containing components that are susceptible to a Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability for HTTP/2 servers.

policies.name: Red Hat Package Manager Execution
policies.description: Alert when Red Hat/Fedora/CentOS package manager programs are executed at runtime.

policies.name: Red Hat Package Manager in Image
policies.description: Alert on deployments with components of the Red Hat/Fedora/CentOS package management system.

policies.name: Remote File Copy Binary Execution
policies.description: Alert on deployments that execute a remote file copy tool

policies.name: Required Annotation: Email
policies.description: Alert on deployments missing the 'email' annotation

policies.name: Required Annotation: Owner/Team
policies.description: Alert on deployments missing the 'owner' or 'team' annotation

policies.name: Required Image Label
policies.description: Alert on deployments with images missing the specified label.

policies.name: Required Label: Owner/Team
policies.description: Alert on deployments missing the 'owner' or 'team' label

policies.name: Secret Mounted as Environment Variable
policies.description: Alert on deployments with Kubernetes secret mounted as environment variable

policies.name: Secure Shell Server (sshd) Execution
policies.description: Detects container running the SSH daemon

policies.name: Secure Shell (ssh) Port Exposed
policies.description: Alert on deployments exposing port 22, commonly reserved for SSH access.

policies.name: Secure Shell (ssh) Port Exposed in Image
policies.description: Alert on deployments exposing port 22, commonly reserved for SSH access.

policies.name: SetUID Processes
policies.description: Processes that are known to use setuid binaries

policies.name: Shadow File Modification
policies.description: Processes that indicate attempts to modify shadow files

policies.name: Shell Management
policies.description: Commands that are used to add/remove a shell

policies.name: Shell Spawned by Java Application
policies.description: Detects execution of shell (bash/csh/sh/zsh) as a subprocess of a java application

policies.name: Spring4Shell (Spring Framework Remote Code Execution) and Spring Cloud Function vulnerabilities
policies.description: Alert on deployments with images containing Spring4Shell vulnerability CVE-2022-22965 which affects the Spring MVC component and vulnerability CVE-2022-22963 which affects the Spring Cloud component. There are flaws in Spring Cloud Function (versions 3.1.6, 3.2.2 and older unsupported versions) and in Spring Framework (5.3.0 to 5.3.17, 5.2.0 to 5.2.19 and older unsupported versions).

policies.name: systemctl Execution
policies.description: Detected usage of the systemctl service manager

policies.name: systemd Execution
policies.description: Detected usage of the systemd service manager

policies.name: Ubuntu Package Manager Execution
policies.description: Alert when Debian/Ubuntu package manager programs are executed at runtime

policies.name: Ubuntu Package Manager in Image
policies.description: Alert on deployments with components of the Debian/Ubuntu package management system in the image.

policies.name: Unauthorized Network Flow
policies.description: This policy generates a violation for the network flows that fall outside baselines for which 'alert on anomalous violations' is set.

policies.name: Unauthorized Process Execution
policies.description: This policy generates a violation for any process execution that is not explicitly allowed by a locked process baseline for a given container specification within a Kubernetes deployment.

policies.name: Wget in Image
policies.description: Alert on deployments with wget present
